title: Americans wore hats all day, every day up until the 1960s. Now no one wears a hat as part of their daily attire. Why? What changed? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I beg to differ. Here in the Pacific Northwest, everyone who wears glasses sports a hat with either a front bill or a wide all-around brim. It keeps the moisture off your lenses. When it’s hot and sunny (which does occasionally happen)? Well, then you have to keep your face free of sunburn. If you’re experiencing male pattern baldness (as I am), you also need to keep your scalp unburned. Of course, most of these hats are purely functional and not really decorative or fashionable. Perhaps they’re one of the root causes of the Northwest “grunge” look.

They got smart. I can’t stand them. Can’t stand something on my head. And I’ve lived in some pretty cold places before moving to the desert in south California. I don’t know how they did it. All you do is sweat constantly even if it’s cool outside and then you have to worry about wind gusts. I think men just realized that it was a completely unnecessary piece of apparel and you had to take it off when you got into your car anyway.
